title: Monthly Business Survey - Retail Sales Index

questions.title: What are the dates of the sales period you are reporting for?
questions.description: If possible, this should be for the period 4th January 2016 to 31st January 2016

questions.title: Commodities - Retail Turnover
questions.description:
- You should enter figures for the reporting period stated above
- You should round your figures to the nearest (£) pound

Include

  • VAT
  • Internet Sales

responses.label: What was the value of the business's total sales of food?
responses.guidance:
Include

  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • all fresh food
  • other food for human consumption (except chocolate and sugar confectionary)
  • soft drinks

Exclude

  • sales from catering facilities used by customers

responses.label: What was the value of the business's total sales of clothing and footwear
responses.guidance:
Include

  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • clothing and footwear
  • clothing fabrics
  • haberdashery and furs
  • leather and travel goods
  • handbags
  • umbrellas

responses.label: What was the value of the business's total sales of household goods
responses.guidance:
Include

  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • carpets, rugs and other floor coverings
  • furniture
  • household textiles and soft furnishings
  • prints and picture frames
  • antiques and works of art
  • domestic electrical appliance, audio/visual equipment and home computers
  • lighting and minor electrical supplies
  • records, compact discs, audio and video tapes
  • musical instruments and goods
  • decorators’ and DIY supplies
  • lawn-mowers
  • hardware
  • china, glassware and cutlery
  • novelties, souvenirs and gifts

responses.label: What was the value of the business's total sales of alcohol, confectionary and tobacco
responses.guidance:
Include

  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • all fresh food
  • other food for human consumption (except chocolate and sugar confectionary)
  • soft drinks

Exclude

  • sales from catering facilities used by customers

responses.label: What was the value of the business’s total sales of other Goods
responses.guidance:
Include

  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • toiletries and medications (except NHS receipts)
  • newspapers and periodicals
  • books, stationery and office supplies
  • photographic and optical goods
  • spectacles, contact lenses and sunglasses
  • toys and games
  • cycles and cycle accessories
  • sport and camping equipment
  • jewellery
  • silverware and plate, clocks and watches
  • household cleaning products and kitchen paper products
  • pets, pets’ requisites and pet foods
  • cut flowers, plants, seeds and other garden sundries
  • other new and second hand goods

Exclude

  • revenue from mobile phone network commission and top up
  • lottery sales and commission from lottery sales
  • sales of car accessories and motor vehicles
  • NHS receipts

responses.label: What was the value of the business’s total retail turnover?
responses.guidance:
Include

  • VAT
  • internet sales
  • retail sale from outlets in Great Britain to customers abroad

Exclude

  • revenue from mobile phone network commission and top up
  • lottery sales and commission from lottery sales
  • sales of car accessories and motor vehicles
  • NHS receipts

responses.label: Of these figures, how much were from internet sales?
responses.guidance:
Include

  • VAT
  • sales from orders received over the internet, irrespective of the payment or delivery method.

questions.title: On 12 January 2016 what was the number of employees for the business named above?
questions.description:
An employee is anyone aged 16 years or over that your organisation directly pays from its payroll(s), in return for carrying out a full-time or part-time job or being on a training scheme.

Include:

  • all workers paid directly from this business’s payroll(s)
  • those temporarily absent but still being paid, for example on maternity leave

Exclude:

  • agency workers paid directly from the agency payroll
  • voluntary workers
  • former employees only receiving pension
  • self-employed workers
  • working owners who are not paid via PAYE

responses.label: Male employees working more than 30 hours per week?
Male employees working less than 30 hours per week?
Female employees working more than 30 hours per week?
Female employees working less than 30 hours per week?
Please explain any movements in your data e.g. sale held, branches opened or sold, extreme weather, or temporary closure of shop
